simplenlg.lexicon
Interface LexiconInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Lexicon
public interface LexiconInterface

This is the basic interface implementing a Lexicon. A Lexicon is conceived as a repository of LexicalItems, each of which is defined for a finite number of morphological operations, depending on its grammatical category. The interface defines a few minimal requirements, mainly related to the addition and retrieval of items from the Lexicon.

Author:
agatt

addItem

Add an item to this Lexicon by passing it a word and a Category The Lexicon will construct a new item, depending on the category passed.

Parameters:
cat - The Category
word - The baseform of the lexical item.

getItem

LexicalItem getItem(String word)
Get the LexicalItem with baseform word

Parameters:
word - The baseform
Returns:
The LexicalItem with the baseform word if it is contained in this simplenlg.lexicon, null otherwise.

                String word)
Check whether this Lexicon contains a LexicalItem of Category cat with baseform word

Parameters:

word - The baseform
Returns:
